docs.text: Welcome to MkDocs For full documentation visit mkdocs.org . Commands mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project. mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server. mkdocs build - Build the documentation site. mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit. Project layout mkdocs.yml # The configuration file. docs/ index.md # The documentation homepage. ... # Other markdown pages, images and other files.
docs.title: About

docs.text: Jack Georgeson At A Glance Medium, Neutral Good Level 3, Mountain Dwarf, Paladin (Oath of Devotion) - Armor Class 19 (Chainmail, shield) - Hit Points 37 - Speed 25ft. - Proficiency Bonus +2 - Initiative +0 STR DEX CON INT WIS CHA 17 (+3) 10 (+0) 16 (+3) 8 (-1) 12 (+1) 14 (+2) Saving Throws Wisdom, Charisma Skills Animal Handling, Insight, Perception, Religion Passive Perception 13 Passive Investigation 9 Passive Insight 13 Languages Common, Dwarvish, Elvish, Halfling Backstory found by a human pastor and his wife (George and Judy), hidden among the wreckage and complete devastation and massacre of a dwarven caravan jack was taken in and raised as their own. not having any idea who or what killed his kin. they salvaged a few relics from the debris (chain mail, a holy symbol, and a medallion with a crest of some kind). they knew not which god or family the holy symbol or crest represented having very little knowledge of the dwarven culture jack grew up in a small country village believing himself to be a human child just like all the other villagers, his parents not telling him otherwise so as to not make him miserable and an outcast. the village likewise accepted him as one of them. he was raised in the ways of the church of Palor and as he grew started training to become a paladin of his faith. A time came when Jack felt restless, and was noticing that he didnt quite fit in with the other children his age and so, decided he wanted to pursue his studies elsewhere, and experience more of the world so that he may better serve his god. his parents sent him on his way with a small amount of gold and and presented him with some items they had salvaged from the destroyed caravan. still unwilling to tell their son the truth, they explained that they hoped these items may help him on his journey. he recieved a holy symbol from an unknown deity and a medallion with a crest that was unfamiliar to anyone in the village, and a set of old and discoloured chain mail that was well made and fitted him well enough. jack set out to discover the world with the blessings of his parents, not knowing the truths he would discover about himself.
docs.title: Jack Georgeson

docs.text: found by a human pastor and his wife (George and Judy), hidden among the wreckage and complete devastation and massacre of a dwarven caravan jack was taken in and raised as their own. not having any idea who or what killed his kin. they salvaged a few relics from the debris (chain mail, a holy symbol, and a medallion with a crest of some kind). they knew not which god or family the holy symbol or crest represented having very little knowledge of the dwarven culture jack grew up in a small country village believing himself to be a human child just like all the other villagers, his parents not telling him otherwise so as to not make him miserable and an outcast. the village likewise accepted him as one of them. he was raised in the ways of the church of Palor and as he grew started training to become a paladin of his faith. A time came when Jack felt restless, and was noticing that he didnt quite fit in with the other children his age and so, decided he wanted to pursue his studies elsewhere, and experience more of the world so that he may better serve his god. his parents sent him on his way with a small amount of gold and and presented him with some items they had salvaged from the destroyed caravan. still unwilling to tell their son the truth, they explained that they hoped these items may help him on his journey. he recieved a holy symbol from an unknown deity and a medallion with a crest that was unfamiliar to anyone in the village, and a set of old and discoloured chain mail that was well made and fitted him well enough. jack set out to discover the world with the blessings of his parents, not knowing the truths he would discover about himself.
